timeline.message:
[sonos] Add null annotations

Signed-off-by: Laurent Garnier <lg.hc@free.fr>

timeline.bodyHTML:
I don't think clone is ever supposed to return null normally. Honestly the use of clone is outdated to begin with and would much rather a custom method created for this instead. But if you don't want to go through the work of replacing the clone method I suggest you just throw some type of runtime exception instead of returning null. Also, you can override the return type as well.

Suggested change
public @Nullable Object clone() {
try {
return super.clone();
} catch (Exception e) {
return null;
}
}
public SonosAlarm clone() {
try {
return (SonosAlarm) super.clone();
} catch (Exception e) {
throw new UnsupportedOperationException(e);
}
}
timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText:
I will try to suppress the clone method.
We have another one in another class.
replies.author: lolodomo

replies.bodyText:
I found no reason to implement Clonable in the class SonosAlarm !
Removed.
replies.author: lolodomo

replies.bodyText: Yes you're right, I have to check why I added that, I just remember it was to avoid a warning.
replies.author: lolodomo

replies.bodyText: Ok, it was in fact to avoid an error at the next line (call to handleSharedQueue with a nullable currentURI).

timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
ZonePlayerHandler handler = (ZonePlayerHandler) thing.getHandler();
if (handler != null) {
return handler;
}
ThingHandler handler = thing.getHandler();
if(handler instanceof ZonePlayerHandler){
return (ZonePlayerHandler) handler;
}
timeline.author: cpmeister

timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
ZonePlayerHandler handler = (ZonePlayerHandler) aThing.getHandler();
if (handler != null) {
return handler;
}
ThingHandler handler = thing.getHandler();
if(handler instanceof ZonePlayerHandler){
return (ZonePlayerHandler) handler;
}

timeline.author: cpmeister

timeline.body:
```suggestion
                                resultString = "";
```
I do find it strange that this field is only initialized here when later code uses it in a possibly uninitialized state.
timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
resultString = new String();
resultString = "";

I do find it strange that this field is only initialized here when later code uses it in a possibly uninitialized state.
timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText:
Changed to "".
resultString is initialized to null, this is expected, the idea is to triger a change only when this is really expected.
replies.author: lolodomo

&& currentVolume != null) {
int i = Integer.valueOf(currentVolume);
newValue = String.valueOf(Math.max(0, i - 1));
} else if (command instanceof OnOffType && command == OnOffType.ON) {
newValue = "100";

&& currentVolume != null) {
